questions.question: Jesse Pollak noted that many people were surprisingly late to discovering which specific AI large language model provider?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak was surprised people were discovering/trying Claude so late, noting it highlights the massive distribution advantage of ChatGPT and Gemini.

questions.question: What primary developer tool did Neynar automate documentation publishing for on January 2nd, 2026?
questions.explanation: Neynar automated publishing documentation for their Node.js SDK, including linking functions back to the API reference.

questions.question: What are the three specific areas Jesse Pollak planned to upgrade on dev.neynar.com on January 13th, potentially causing minor downtime?
options: Authentication, user management, and team management
Front-end UI, Back-end storage, and Database
questions.explanation: The planned upgrades were specific to authentication, user management, and team management.

questions.question: According to the Anthropic report shared by Jesse Pollak, what percentage of blockchain exploits carried out in the post-March 2025 benchmark could have been executed autonomously by current AI agents?
questions.explanation: The post cited that AI agents had gone from exploiting 2% to 55.88% of vulnerabilities in the specified benchmark period.

questions.question: What is the implied preceding activity that Jesse Pollak referred to when he stated, 'We read a chain now, we write to a chain next'?
questions.explanation: The post implies Neynar is currently capable of reading chain data, and writing (executing transactions) is the next functional target.

questions.question: Which specific UI component did Jesse Pollak mention was 'made for the bots, curated by the humans at neynar' and was seeking human feedback on?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak was asking for feedback on the @neynar/ui framework.

questions.question: What financial milestone did the official Base account mention achieving in March 2024?
questions.explanation: The account stated: 'last week we doubled our revenue and I have no idea why'.

questions.question: Which developer priority listed by Jesse Pollak focuses on 'vibe code mini apps'?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak listed 'App studio: vibe code mini apps' as one of the top priorities in November 2025.

questions.question: What was the purpose of simplifying webhook filter configurations on dev.neynar.com, as mentioned in the December 23rd, 2025 post?
options: To allow configuration via natural language using an App Studio agent
questions.explanation: The ultimate goal of simplifying the underlying MCP tool was to power the App Studio agent, allowing users to configure filters using natural language.

questions.question: Dan Romero identified the 'hobgoblin of the terminally online mind' as which specific trait?
questions.explanation: Dan Romero defined the hobgoblin as 'high confidence despite low context'.

questions.question: Which specific crypto/meme standard did Brian Armstrong reference in a post on January 15th, 2026?
questions.explanation: Brian Armstrong posted simply: 'the $dickbutt standard'.

questions.question: When discussing unsolved vibe coding problems, Dan Romero noted that subdomains are not consumer-grade and that which company currently 'seems best' for deployment flow/domain names?
questions.explanation: Dan Romero mentioned Vercel as seemingly the best solution for domain names/subdomains.

A quote cast with an image attachment

questions.question: In Dan Romero's suggested app idea, 'Sunday Times,' what is the primary restriction on the content of the post?
options: Must be a full thought piece
Must only be a URL link
questions.explanation: The rule was: 'Post is only a URL, e.g. link to a cast, tweet, blog, etc.'

questions.question: What specific type of market did Jesse Pollak state he wanted to resolve, rather than make or bet on?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak said: 'everyone wants to make or bet on prediction markets. i want to resolve them.'

questions.question: Jesse Pollak compared the market order spread on BTC/USD or BTC/USDC pairs between which two US exchanges?
questions.explanation: He specifically listed Coinbase Advanced (1%) and Robinhood (0.85%).

options: They rely too heavily on AI generation
They are too similar, citing Bootstrap / Shadcn
They are too difficult for beginners to customize
questions.explanation: Dan Romero noted, 'Default aesthetics are too similar, e.g. Bootstrap (in a prior era) / Shadcn herding effect'.

questions.question: What analogy did the Base account use in November 2022 to compare current crypto journalism?
options: The invention of the printing press
Early media coverage of the internet revolution
questions.explanation: Base shared a piece comparing early internet journalism to crypto journalism.

questions.question: Based on Jesse Pollak's priorities listed in November 2025, what specific data sources were required for 'Developer infra'?
questions.explanation: Priority 1 was 'Developer infra: Farcaster + onchain data'.

questions.explanation: The question asked for the best advice for 'staying consistent but still pushing yourself.'

questions.explanation: The post explicitly links to a Python port of '@farcaster/hub-nodejs'.

questions.question: Which entity/person was Jesse Pollak trying to assemble a team of 'white hat agents' to counter the autonomous exploit risk?
options: No entity named; it was a general query.
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak shared the Anthropic report and then asked, 'Who is assembling the team of white hat agents?'

questions.question: What was the core reason Jesse Pollak cited for the 'joyful' nature of feature requests they've already shipped?

It results in positive casting age metrics.
It suggests the requests were technically trivial.
questions.explanation: The statement suggests that Neynar is already anticipating and building features before users formally request them, validating the product vision.

questions.question: In his general advice for builders, Jesse Pollak stated the desired progression is 'from 1 to N,' followed by what directive?
questions.explanation: The full post was: 'from 1 to N - build more!'

questions.explanation: He noted Coinbase Advanced is at 1% while Robinhood is at 0.85%.

questions.explanation: The first role hiring for was a product designer to help shape the product from the ground up.

Analyzing his casts over the last year

questions.question: Based on Jesse Pollak's data point, what was the total exploit revenue generated in 2025 by human attackers, $4.6 million of which AI could have executed autonomously?
options: The total amount was not specified, only the AI executable portion.
questions.explanation: The text states AI exploits jumped 'from $5,000 to $4.6 million in total exploit revenue.' $4.6 million is the measure of revenue from *AI executable* exploits, not the total revenue generated by all human attackers.

A quote cast with an image attachment
A full body image of him sitting across from the Dino priest

options: Deployment flow with database, auth, payments
questions.explanation: He listed deployment flow, domain names, aesthetics, and planning/agents. Lack of educational resources was not mentioned.

questions.explanation: The updates were 'Just in time App Studio updates for you to build something over the holidays'.

questions.explanation: These changes were made to simplify configuring webhook filters.

To notify users with a list of 1 link from everyone they follow
To alert users when a new post is available
To remind users to post their weekly URL

Product Designer to shape the product
Marketer to focus on web3 articles
